snippet: At least two million people also fall ill each year, officials found in research that was the first to quantify a growing public health problem.
abstract: Study by Centers for Disease Control and Prevention finds that at least two million Americans fall ill from antibiotic-resistant bacteria every year and that at least 23,000 die from those infections, putting a hard number on a growing public health threat.
lead_paragraph: At least two million people also fall ill each year, officials found in research that was the first to quantify a growing public health problem.

headline.main: Antibiotic-Resistant Infections Lead to 23,000 Deaths a Year, C.D.C. Finds
headline.print_headline: Antibiotic-Resistant Infections Lead to 23,000 Deaths a Year, C.D.C. Finds

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
